task.title: Configuring administration security
task.shortdesc: Configure administration security by using the user registry.

context.p: The default user registry is the default file-based user registry.

step.cmd: Browse to Security Global security .
Set the Available realm definitions to be Federated repositories and select Configure.
Set the Primary administrative username to be websphere.
Select Automatically generated server identity.
Select Ignore case for authorization and select OK.
Enter the password for the default administrative user, for example: websphere, enter the confirmation and select OK to confirm the changes.
Select Enable administrative security.
Select Enable application security.
Select Use Java 2 security to restrict application access to local resources and Warn if applications are granted custom permissions.
Set the Available realm definitions to be Federated repositories.
Select Apply to confirm the changes.
Select Security Global security .
Expand Web and SIP Security and select Single sign-on (SSO).
Select Requires SSL.
Select OK to confirm the change.
Select Security Global Security .
Select the Custom Properties link.
Select New and set the name and value as follows:
Select OK to add the new property.
Select New and set the name and value as follows:
Select OK to confirm the change.
Save the changes to the master configuration.
